natural_number.def:
The set of Natural numbers.
These are all positive whole numbers.

real_number.def:
The set of Real numbers.
These are all positive and negative numbers; including fractions, decimals, and even irrational numbers such as pi and e.

integer_number.def:
The set of Integer numbers.
These are all whole positive and negative numbers.

rational_number.def: The set of Rational numbers. These are all positive and negative numbers which can be expressed as a fraction.

inequality.def:
Whereas an equation shows two values which are equal to each other, an inequality show two values which not always equal.

The first value may be
- greater than
- less than
- greater than or equal to
  or
- less than or equal to
the second value.

less_than_or_equal_to.def: The value of to the left side of this symbol is less than or equal to the value to the right side.

greater_than_or_equal_to.def: The value to the left side of this symbol is greater than or equal to the value to the right side.

expand.def: To multiple out all terms in an equation. The opposite of factorisation.

substitute.def: To replace an unknown term with a specific value.
substitute.example: With the substitution of x = 5, the expression x2 + 2 becomes 52 + 2.

coefficient.def: The number which an unknown term is being mulipled by.
coefficient.example: With 5x<sup>2</sup>, 5 is the coefficient of x<sup>2</sup>
